department.ch: 材料科學與工程研究所碩士班
department.en: Institute of Materials Science and Engineering

goal.ch: 材料科學工程教育範圍廣泛，橫跨理、工學院，物理冶金乃一門深入的材料科學。透過本課程，使學習者能深入瞭解材料中：微結構、製程、性質三者對於材料應用時之影響，於現代工業設計中佔有極重要的地位。本課程首先介紹材料之晶體結構，與材料微結構的各種分析技術。進而延伸到材料缺陷理論，如差排理論、空孔、界面等。並探討材料之動態時效應變、強化現象、動態回復、再結晶核的形成與成長，以便於充分了解材料特性之理論基礎，利用此項基礎，進而以微觀的觀點，分析及探討近年來新材料發展之原理。
goal.en: Advanced Physical Metallurgy is an in-depth material science. Through this course, learners can deeply understand the influence of materials: microstructure, manufacturing process, and properties on the application of materials, which is an extremely important position in modern industrial design. This course first introduces the crystal structure of the material and various analysis techniques for the microstructure of the material. It then extends to the theory of material defects, such as the theory of dislocation, voids, and interfaces. It also discusses the dynamic time-effect change, strengthening phenomenon, dynamic recovery, and the formation and growth of recrystallization nuclei.

outline.ch: 本課程講述物理冶金重要知識，針對相平衡圖、擴散行為、凝固與析出、成長與孕核、變形雙晶與麻田散反應、鐵碳合金系統、鋼鐵硬化及非鐵金屬等內容，做一詳細介紹，使學生能建立材料科學之基礎知識，並進一步將所學與未來相關研究結合。此課程為以課堂授課為主。
outline.en: This course introduces the important knowledge of physical metallurgy. Phase diagrams, diffusion in solids, solidification and precipitation, nucleation and growth, deformation twinning and martensite, iron-carbon alloy system, hardening of steel, and nonferrous alloy systems are stated in detail. The objective of this course is to establish the basic knowledge of materials science for the students and to further connect the knowledge to related future researches.
